Job Description and Requirements
Virtual Prototypes are simulation models for a variety of electronic platforms in the automotive, enterprise, telecommunications or cloud market today
Our Virtual Prototyping team delivers these models to our worldwide customers and enables them to start with product development long before hardware is available
In your new Virtual Prototyping Software Engineer role you will:
Work in a team environment developing high-performance pre-silicon Virtual Platforms and processor models
Integrate models and platforms from Synopsys partners
Configure and bring up complex software stacks and drivers on the simulated hardware
Identify issues and investigate their root cause
Work closely with other development teams, 3rd party suppliers, support engineers and customers to identify, implement and deliver solutions
Based in central Edinburgh with flexible working from home arrangements
Key Requirements:
Good programming skills, ideally with some C++
Scripting Languages, preferably Python
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills
BS or MS Computer Science / Electronics or similar
Useful to Have:
Exposure to open-source software, ideally including QEMU
Linux/Android OS build, configuration and debug
Embedded, and ability to interpret H/W device specifications
Experience with Arm cores and/or knowledge of Arm architecture or is an advantage
Experience in a C++ software development role
SystemC and transaction-level modelling knowledge would be beneficial but not essential
